column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Walking into Jinya feels like walking into an authentic ramen shop out of Japan. The bar at the front greets you with people sitting alone on their lunch break
column2: but when you walk behind it opens into a much larger eatery. There's a communal eating table in the center of the room surrounded by smaller booths and another bar at the back. I recommend sitting at the back bar to watch how the ramen is made! Everything is delicious but my favorite is the garlic and pork based cha cha cha. Add a soft boiled egg to everything! You won't be disappointed. The meal add ons are also great if you have room with your ramen! You can add a salad and gyoza for a few extra bucks!
